intro: Phyllanthus mucronatus, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, round, yellow fruits. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Phyllanthus mucronatus is also notable for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
